comments:
My environment: 
Tomcat 5.0.28
J2EE version: 1.4
Eclipse: 3.1M5 with WTP M3

This error occurred shortly after selecting the default configuration for the
"Service Deployment Configuration" dialog box of the Web Service wizard.

I have the wsdl4j.jar in the \plugins\org.eclipse.wst.wsdl_1.0.0\lib as per the
instructions (which is where this class is located).

The NoClassDefFoundError you're getting suggests either WSDL4J or something it 
depends upon is missing. Since the you've copied wsdl4j-1_4/lib/wsdl4j.jar into 
org.eclipse.wst.wsdl_1.0.0/lib, the only other potentially missing jar that 
springs to mind is qname.jar. Did you also copy this one from wsdl4j-1_4/lib to 
org.eclipse.wst.wsdl_1.0.0/lib?

Chris,

My apologies. I forgot to execute Eclipse with the -clean option after 
installing. This got me as far as the next dialog, which generated the wsdl 
file. I did, however, get an error dialog "IWAB0489E Error when deploying Web 
service to Axis runtime" which was a NullPointerException. No stack trace, 
though, to tell me where it's coming from. But this is probably a different 
bug. I'll take this offline to the newsgroup.


(In reply to comment #1)
> The NoClassDefFoundError you're getting suggests either WSDL4J or something 
it 
> depends upon is missing. Since the you've copied wsdl4j-1_4/lib/wsdl4j.jar 
into 
> org.eclipse.wst.wsdl_1.0.0/lib, the only other potentially missing jar that 
> springs to mind is qname.jar. Did you also copy this one from wsdl4j-1_4/lib 
to 
> org.eclipse.wst.wsdl_1.0.0/lib?

No worries. As you can see, I didn't think to suggest "-clean" either; and I've 
forgotten it more than once myself.

Error IWAB0489E appears to be a duplicate of 84843 [1], for which we have a fix 
in the wings. It occurs when the wizard is unable to successfully transmit the 
Axis WSDD file (deployment descriptor) to the Axis servlet, which in turns 
happens because the Axis Web module isn't quite up and running in Tomcat at the 
time the wizard tries to send the WSDD. If you retry the wizard after the error 
happens, you should be successful. BTW, based on the code, if you run Eclipse 
with -consoleLog, you should see a stack trace in the console when this error 
occurs.

[1] https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=84843
